revised_title: Radiological Criteria for the Disposal of Solid Radioactive Wastes: A Global Perspective
tldr: This article discusses the radiological criteria for the disposal of solid radioactive wastes, emphasizing the importance of following a global system for protection against radiation hazards. The author highlights the need for pursuing scientific analysis of waste disposal to address public concerns and political judgments. The article also explores the role of comparisons with natural levels of radiation and the long timescales of concern in waste management decisions.
